intro: Epidendrum tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its upright, cane-like growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Epidendrum tridens is a popular choice for indoor cultivation due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
